title: Language-Based Interpersonal Skills Development Project for Strengthening Accounting Job Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge and extensive practical experience in the field, accounting terminology understanding, and business document drafting experience
context.additional_context: Team-based collaborative learning in a simulation environment using real SME accounting cases. Feedback focused on language proficiency, including specialized terminology, sentence structure, and logical expression in accounting report writing.

learning_goals: In a 4-person team project, learners apply ≥3 collaboration strategies (e.g., role division, feedback routines) using negotiation and communication skills (active listening, opinion coordination) when drafting accounting reports, and submit the final report reflecting ≥80% of team agreements. Special emphasis is placed on professional terminology and clear expression.

Learners write ≥3 self-reflection reports using a peer assessment system and provide structured feedback (2 content items, 2 expression items) on ≥5 peers’ presentations, considering grammatical accuracy and vocabulary appropriateness.

Strengthening critical thinking and teamwork for solving complex accounting problems: Focus on interpreting professional terminology, logical expression in report writing, and improving communication efficiency among peers.

resources: Online collaboration platforms (e.g., Notion, Google Workspace)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
